step1.sentence: After years of playing it safe, Maya finally decided to seize the day and quit her stable job to pursue her dream of painting.

step2.story: Jake had been putting off his trip to Japan for three years, always finding another excuse to wait. One morning he woke up, booked the flight, and thought — it's time to seize the day. He landed in Tokyo two weeks later with nothing but a backpack and a wide grin.

step3.story: Elena stood at the edge of the stage, heart hammering, watching the audition list shrink to her name. She had rehearsed this moment a hundred times in her bedroom mirror, but now, with real spotlights bearing down, doubt crept in. Her teacher's voice echoed in her mind: 'You only get so many chances — seize the day.' She took a slow breath, walked into the light, and began to sing. By the last note, the room was silent in the best possible way. She had seized it — every trembling, glorious second of it.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 직역하면 '하루를 잡아라'로, 지금 이 순간을 놓치지 말라는 뜻이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 현재의 기회를 망설이지 않고 적극적으로 붙잡으라고 권유할 때 사용한다. 주로 두려움이나 망설임을 극복하고 행동에 나서도록 격려하는 맥락에서 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 라틴어 'Carpe diem'에서 유래했으며, 로마 시인 호라티우스가 기원전 23년에 쓴 시에서 처음 등장했다. 'Carpe'는 '잡다·수확하다', 'diem'은 '하루'를 뜻한다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 즉흥적 행동보다는 두려움을 이기고 의미 있는 도전에 나서는 결단의 뉘앙스가 강하다. 격려·동기부여 상황에서 긍정적이고 영감을 주는 어조로 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: You've been talking about starting your own business for years — seize the day and just do it.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 몇 년째 창업 얘기만 하고 있잖아 — 지금 바로 도전해봐.
